channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jack Schlossberg, Social Media Provocateur, Gives Politics a Try
item.description: As he prepares a Congressional run, J.F.K.’s grandson admits, “I’m not for everybody.”

item.title: Sea shares dip by over 8% as profit comes in below analyst expectations
item.description: Sea’s operating expenses rose 28% in the past quarter, with its e-commerce arm—Shopee—looking to strengthen its competitive edge over rivals.

item.title: Most Women Can Still Get Abortion Pills. That May Soon Change.
item.description: American women need the freedom to determine the course of their own lives.

item.title: The Business Elite Needs Mamdani. They Just Don’t Know It Yet.
item.description: The threat from Washington is going to require teamwork.

item.title: How a New Bridge Partly Collapsed in China’s Southwest
item.description: A section of the tall bridge in mountainous Sichuan Province fell, apparently after a landslide. No casualties were reported.

item.title: Northern Lights Dazzle U.S. Skies as Far South as Alabama
item.description: The night skies across the United States lit up as fast-moving charged particles from the sun slammed into the Earth’s atmosphere.

item.title: Syria’s Leaders Pledge to Join Fight Against Islamic State
item.description: Large parts of Syria were once overrun by the terrorist group Islamic State. The country’s new government has just committed to a global effort to fig...

item.title: Blue Diamond Sells for $25.6 Million at Auction in Switzerland
item.description: A 9.51-carat blue stone that once belonged to the heiress Bunny Mellon sold for $7 million less than at its last auction, a sign of profound shifts in...

item.title: A Look Into the Early Days of Migrant Detentions at Guantánamo
item.description: Government employees distributed Bibles and prepared materials “commonly used in Hinduism, Sikhism and Rastafarianism,” according to emails.

item.title: Blood and Tears as Spain’s Troubled Bullfighting Star Hangs Up His Cape
item.description: José Antonio Morante Camacho says he has fought his last bull. Fans appreciated his artistry but also his honesty about his struggles with mental illn...

item.title: Japan’s Prime Minister Faces Backlash Over 3 A.M. Staff Meeting
item.description: Sanae Takaichi drew criticism for requiring staff to work in the wee hours in a country scarred by “death from overwork.”

item.title: Exclusive: Coinbase and stablecoin startup BVNK call off $2 billion acquisition
item.description: BVNK was previously fielding offers from not only Coinbase but Mastercard.

item.title: Chinese ‘cryptoqueen’ who allegedly scammed thousands jailed in UK over Bitcoin stash worth $6.6 billion
item.description: Police said the investigation into Zhimin Qian, 47, led to officers recovering devices holding 61,000 Bitcoin in the largest cryptocurrency seizure in...

item.title: Shares of Winklevoss’s Gemini sag as crypto firm losses grow
item.description: The company’s struggles come two months after IPO.

item.title: Private equity could transform your retirement, but only if it adapts to protect savers
item.description: Private equity wants In on Your 401(k). Let’s get the safeguards right.
